dataType.name: IPAddress
dataType.description: IP address, i.e. IPv4 address (or IPv4 subnet mask) or IPv6 address. All IPv4 addresses and subnet masks MUST be represented as strings in IPv4 dotted-decimal notation. Here are some examples of valid IPv4 address textual representations: * 216.52.29.100 * 192.168.1.254 All IPv6 addresses MUST be represented using any of the 3 standard textual representations defined in {{bibref|RFC4291}} Sections 2.2.1, 2.2.2 and 2.2.3. Both lower-case and upper-case letters can be used, but use of lower-case letters is RECOMMENDED. Here are some examples of valid IPv6 address textual representations: * 1080:0:0:800:ba98:3210:11aa:12dd * 1080::800:ba98:3210:11aa:12dd * 0:0:0:0:0:0:13.1.68.3 IPv6 addresses MUST NOT include zone identifiers. Zone identifiers are discussed in {{bibref|RFC4007|Section 6}}. Unspecified or inapplicable addresses (or IPv4 subnet masks) MUST be represented as empty strings unless otherwise specified by the parameter definition.

dataType.name: IPv4Address
dataType.description: IPv4 address (or subnet mask). Can be any IPv4 address that is permitted by the ''IPAddress'' data type.

dataType.name: IPv6Address
dataType.description: IPv6 address. Can be any IPv6 address that is permitted by the ''IPAddress'' data type.

dataType.name: IPPrefix
dataType.description: IPv4 or IPv6 routing prefix in Classless Inter-Domain Routing (CIDR) notation {{bibref|RFC4632}}. This is specified as an IP address followed by an appended "/n" suffix, where ''n'' (the prefix size) is an integer in the range 0-32 (for IPv4) or 0-128 (for IPv6) that indicates the number of (leftmost) '1' bits of the routing prefix. * IPv4 example: 192.168.1.0/24 * IPv6 example: 2001:edff:fe6a:f76::/64 If the IP address part is unspecified or inapplicable, it MUST be {{empty}} unless otherwise specified by the parameter definition. In this case the IP prefix will be of the form "/n". If the entire IP prefix is unspecified or inapplicable, it MUST be {{empty}} unless otherwise specified by the parameter definition.

dataType.name: IPv4Prefix
dataType.description: IPv4 address prefix. Can be any IPv4 prefix that is permitted by the ''IPPrefix'' data type.

dataType.name: IPv6Prefix
dataType.description: IPv6 address prefix. Can be any IPv6 prefix that is permitted by the ''IPPrefix'' data type.

dataType.name: MACAddress
dataType.description: All MAC addresses are represented as strings of 12 hexadecimal digits (digits 0-9, letters A-F or a-f) displayed as six pairs of digits separated by colons. Unspecified or inapplicable MAC addresses MUST be represented as empty strings unless otherwise specified by the parameter definition.

dataType.name: StatsCounter32
dataType.description: A 32-bit statistics parameter, e.g. a byte counter. This data type SHOULD NOT be used for statistics parameters whose values might become greater than the maximum value that can be represented as an ''unsignedInt'' (i.e. 0xffffffff, referred to below as ''maxval''). ''StatsCounter64'' SHOULD be used for such parameters. The value ''maxval'' indicates that no data is available for this parameter. In the unlikely event that the actual value of the statistic is ''maxval'', the CPE SHOULD return ''maxval - 1''. The actual value of the statistic might be greater than ''maxval''. Such values SHOULD wrap around through zero. The term ''packet'' is to be interpreted as the transmission unit appropriate to the protocol layer in question, e.g. an IP packet or an Ethernet frame.

dataType.name: StatsCounter64
dataType.description: A 64-bit statistics parameter, e.g. a byte counter. This data type SHOULD be used for all statistics parameters whose values might become greater than the maximum value that can be represented as an ''unsignedInt''. The maximum value that can be represented as an ''unsignedLong'' (i.e. 0xffffffffffffffff) indicates that no data is available for this parameter. The term ''packet'' is to be interpreted as the transmission unit appropriate to the protocol layer in question, e.g. an IP packet or an Ethernet frame.

dataType.name: Alias
dataType.description: A non-volatile handle used to reference this instance. Alias provides a mechanism for an ACS to label this instance for future reference. If the CPE supports the Alias-based Addressing feature as defined in {{bibref|TR-069a4|3.6.1}} and described in {{bibref|TR-069a4|Appendix II}}, the following mandatory constraints MUST be enforced: *Its value MUST NOT be empty. *Its value MUST start with a letter. *If its value is not assigned by the ACS, it MUST start with a "cpe-" prefix. *The CPE MUST NOT change the parameter value.

dataType.name: Dbm1000
dataType.description: The value is measured in ''dBm/1000'', i.e. the value divided by 1000 is dB relative to 1 mW. For example, -12345 means -12.345 dBm, 0 means 0 dBm (1 mW) and 12345 means 12.345 dBm.

dataType.name: IEEE_EUI64
dataType.description: The IEEE EUI 64-bit identifier as defined in {{bibref|EUI64}}. The IEEE defined 64-bit extended unique identifier (EUI-64) is a concatenation of: * The 24-bit (OUI-24) or 36-bit (OUI-36) company_id value assigned by the IEEE Registration Authority (IEEE-RA), and * The extension identifier (40 bits for OUI-24 or 28 bits for OUI-36) assigned by the organization with that company_id assignment.

dataType.name: ZigBeeNetworkAddress
dataType.description: The ZigBee 16-bit network address (NWK) as defined in {{bibref|ZigBee2007}}. The address is assigned to a device by the network layer and used by the network layer for routing messages between devices.

parameter.name: DeviceSummary
parameter.description: Profiles according TR-098A3 which are currently supported for a FON WLAN USB-Host Box: "InternetGatewayDevice:1.4[](Baseline:2, EthernetLAN:1, Time:2, ADSLWAN:1, IPPing:1, WiFiLAN:1, DeviceAssociation:1) VoiceService 1.0[1] (SIPEndpoint:1, Endpoint:1, TAEndpoint:1) StorageService:1.0[1](FTPServer:1, NetServer:1,UserAccess:1,VolumeConfig:1)". On special F!Box hardware (UR8) support of "ADSL2WAN" profile.

parameter.description: If true: firmware or config contains vendor unsupported modifications.

parameter.name: UpgradesManaged
parameter.description: if true firmware update is only possible via TR-069 or Docsis.

parameter.name: ManageableDeviceNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: TR-111 (Part 1) Support, needs TR-069 Stack Version 13.04.04 or higher. See also TR-069 A3, Annex F.

parameter.name: ManageableDeviceNotificationLimit
parameter.description: default: 15 sec

parameter.name: X_AVM-DE_TR069FirmwareDownloadEnabled
parameter.description:
Enables/disables the tr069-download-request (necessary for a firmware-update with tr-069)
Write Access is OEM specific

parameter.name: X_AVM-DE_SessionTerminationWithEmptyPost
parameter.description: CPE sends empty HTTP Post before terminating session. See 3.7.1.3 TR-069 A3.

parameter.name: X_AVM-DE_STB_URL
parameter.description: DHCP option 43.1 in local LAN

parameter.name: X_AVM-DE_STB_ProvCode
parameter.description: DHCP option 43.2 in local LAN

parameter.name: X_AVM-DE_STB_Matchoption
parameter.description: Matchoption for connected LAN-Devices to use DHCP 43 in LAN

parameter.name: X_AVM-DE_ConnectionRequestEnable
parameter.description: Enables or disables the ConnectionRequest port.

parameter.name: X_AVM-DE_ConnectionRequestSecurityEnable
parameter.description: Enables or disables a security mechanism for TR-069 connection-requests which means that these requests are only permitted for clients with IP addresses resulting from the DNS resolution (IPv4/IPv6) of the ManagementServerURL or as an alternative from the IP addresses/subnets supplied in parameter "X_AVM-DE_ConnectionRequestIPNetList". The dns resolution will be performed with the initialization of the connection request socket and from then on in a periodic interval specified in parameter 'X_AVM-DE_ConnectionRequestDNSUpdateTimeInterval'.

parameter.name: X_AVM-DE_ConnectionRequestIPNetList
parameter.description:
Supplies a comma-seperated list of ip-addresses or ip-subnets (IPv4/IPv6) from which a connection-request will be allowed. (Example: "172.17.1.13,172.16.0.1/16,2001:db8::/32" - means that connection requests are allowed from one single ip-address and two subnets)
Note: Will be only used if parameter "X_AVM-DE_ConnectionRequestSecurityEnable" is set to true (1). Providing an empty list while former parameter is set, means that the DNS resolution mechanism is used for securing the connection-request port.

parameter.name: X_AVM-DE_ConnectionRequestDNSUpdateTimeInterval
parameter.description:
Sets the periodic interval for the dns resoultion of the acs server. Note: Only used if parameter X_AVM-DE_ConnectionRequestSecurityEnable is set to true (1) and parameter X_AVM-DE_ConnectionRequestIPNetList has been left empty.
Default value is 86400 seconds (== one day).

parameter.name: X_AVM-DE_VerifyServer
parameter.description: Enables or disables server certificate check for TLS-secured TR-069 connections and HTTPS downloads. Has no effect on unencrypted connections.

parameter.name: X_AVM-DE_WiFiEnvironmentUploadEnable
parameter.description: Allow the ACS to upload the WiFi environment via TR-069 (type "X 00040E WiFi Environment"). Cannot be disabled after enabling. Cannot be enabled if the feature has been manually disabled by the user. Enabling WiFi environment uploads triggers an event in the F!Box event log.

object.name: InternetGatewayDevice.ManagementServer.ManageableDevice.{i}.
object.description: TR-111 Device Gateway Assoc.; needs TR-069 Stack Version 13.04.04 or higher. See also TR-069 A3, Annex F.

parameter.name: UpgradeAvailable
parameter.description: true if F!Box has been detected a firmware update on a AVM server.

parameter.name: AvailableLanguages
parameter.description: only available on Boxes with MULTI_LANGUAGE support.

parameter.name: CurrentLanguage
parameter.description: only available on Boxes with MULTI_LANGUAGE support. Reboot required.

parameter.name: X_AVM-DE_FirmwareUpdateRequest
parameter.description: Set to "1" to request F!Box performing a firmware update from a AVM server. A firmware update is performed only if "UpgradeAvailable" AND "X_AVM-DE_TR069FirmwareDownloadEnabled" are true.

parameter.name: X_AVM-DE_AutoUpdate
parameter.description: Activate automatic firmware udpates. Allowed values are: 0: disabled 1: check only for available firmware updates 2: check and install important firmware updates 3: check and install all firmware updates

parameter.name: X_AVM-DE_AutoUpdateTime
parameter.description: As soon as an update is available and has been recognized by the FRITZ!Box, the calculated AutoUpdateTime on which the update is carried out is returned. If no update is available an empty value is returned. Note: The time format is the local time of FRITZ!Box configuration (see: InternetGatewayDevice.Time.LocalTimeZoneName)

object.name: InternetGatewayDevice.UserInterface.RemoteAccess.
object.description: F!Box Remote Access, see TR-157

parameter.description: only HTTPS supported

parameter.name: Protocol
parameter.description: only HTTPS supported

parameter.name: Enabled
parameter.description: Indicates whether the user has activated the MaintenanceWindow for updates in the user interface or not

parameter.name: Userdefined
parameter.description: Indicates whether the user has edited the start time of the MaintenanceWindow for updates in the user interface or not

parameter.name: Start
parameter.description: Returns the start time of the MaintenanceWindow as the number of minutes from midnight. Depending on the parameter X_AVM-DE_MaintenanceWindow.Userdefined, this value was automatically determined or set by the user. Notes: - The length of the MaintenanceWindow is fixed: 3 hours - This parameter just takes effect if X_AVM-DE_MaintenanceWindow.Enabled is "true"

parameter.name: ConfigPassword
parameter.description: Set a GUI password for the CPE. This is only allowed if the CPE is unprotected and the user did not set expressly this authorisation method. To check whether the box is protected by any login method, use the parameter X_AVM-DE_BoxAuthRequired. ConfigPassword must have a min lenght of 8 and a max lenght of 32 characters. When read, this parameter returns an empty string, regardless of the actual value.

parameter.name: X_AVM-DE_BoxAuthRequired
parameter.description: Could be used to check whether the FRITZ!Box is protected by a login method (password or user account).

parameter.name: X_AVM-DE_ResetBoxAuth
parameter.description: 'Password forgotten' service: Setting X_AVM-DE_ResetBoxAuth to 'true' starts a time windows of 300 seconds. Withhin this time window user will have the opportunity to set a new password for the FRITZ!Box Web UI. Allowed Value: true.

parameter.name: X_AVM-DE_DownstreamCurrentUtilization

Set value to "Ethernet" to invoke change to WANAccessType "Ethernet" Note: If the change is not possible the existing WANAccessType is retained.
So far no further values are permitted for this parameter.

parameter.name: X_AVM-DE_WANAccessSwitchState
parameter.description:
After setting X_AVM-DE_WANAccessSwitch the status of switching could be determined with this parameter.
Successful change will result in: "PPPoE_success" or "TR069_success" (DHCP) Otherwise an error is returned.

enumeration.description: No action has been started yet

parameter.description: Vectoring upstream. Possible values are "LEGACY", "GVECT_FRIENDLY", "GVECT_FULL"

parameter.description: GInp upstream. Possible values are "RTX_IN_USE", "RTX_NOT_IN_USE_FORBIDDEN", "NOT_IN_USE_NOT_SUPPORTED_XTUC", "NOT_IN_USE_NOT_SUPPORTED_XTUR", "NOT_IN_USE_NOT_SUPPORTED_XTUC_NOR_XTUR", "NOT_IN_USE_REASON_UNDEFINED"

parameter.name: OffsetDsMargin
parameter.description:
WARNING: Changing this value will result in a re-synchronization process of the dsl modem. Connection may be lost for a while. You can find the equivalent setting on "UI (Advanced view) - Internet - DSL Information - Line Settings - Intended signal-to-noise ratio (Receive Direction)".
Maximum Performance[0] ... Maximum Stability[4]

parameter.name: DsINP
parameter.description:
WARNING: Changing this value will result in a re-synchronization process of the dsl modem. Connection may be lost for a while. You can find the equivalent setting on "UI (Advanced view) - Internet - DSL Information - Line Settings - Impulse Noise Protection (INP)".
Maximum Performance[0] ... Maximum Stability[4]

parameter.name: RFI_mode
parameter.description:
WARNING: Changing this value will result in a re-synchronization process of the dsl modem. Connection may be lost for a while. You can find the equivalent setting on "UI (Advanced view) - Internet - DSL Information - Line Settings - Identification of radio frequency interference (RFI)".
Maximum Performance[0] ... Maximum Stability[4]

parameter.name: UsNoiseBits
parameter.description:
WARNING: Changing this value will result in a re-synchronization process of the dsl modem. Connection may be lost for a while. You can find the equivalent setting on "UI (Advanced view) - Internet - DSL Information - Line Settings - Intended signal-to-noise ratio (Send Direction)".
Maximum Performance[0] ... Maximum Stability[4]

parameter.name: DisableUs1WhenDs1LatnIsAboveDb
parameter.description:
WARNING: Changing this value will result in a re-synchronization process of the dsl modem. Connection may be lost for a while.
Specifies the value of LATNds (band DS1) beyond which the band US1 is disabled. '0' means that the default value of the DSL firmware is used, the maximum value is 50.

parameter.name: DisableUs2WhenDs1LatnIsAboveDb
parameter.description:
WARNING: Changing this value will result in a re-synchronization process of the dsl modem. Connection may be lost for a while.
Specifies the value of LATNds (band DS1) beyond which the band US2 is disabled. '0' means that the default value of the DSL firmware is used, the maximum value is 50.

parameter.name: LimitPHYToBookedRate
parameter.description: Limit DSL physical sync rate to booked sync rate. Warning: Changing this value will result in a DSL resync.

enumeration.description: RFC 2516 {{bibref|RFC2516}} PPP over Ethernet on RFC 2684 {{bibref|RFC2684}} bridged Ethernet over ATM

parameter.name: DNSOverrideAllowed
parameter.description: If true, can be overwritten by X_AVM_DE_DNSv4_Proxy_Custom_Forward and X_AVM_DE_DNSv6_Proxy_Custom_Forward_Enable. Override is only applicable on WANxxxConnection.{i}.Name = "internet".

parameter.name: X_AVM_DE_DNSv4_Proxy_Custom_Forward
parameter.description: Commaseparated list of DNSv4 servers. They will be used instead of "DNSServers" for DNS requests from connected LAN clients (Homenet).

parameter.description: If true, override DNSv4 server assigned by DHCP.

parameter.name: X_AVM_DE_DNSv6_Proxy_Custom_Forward
parameter.description: Commaseparated list of DNSv6 servers. They will be used instead of "DNSServers" for DNS requests from connected LAN clients (Homenet).

Special behaviour on 'internet' connection: IP protocol on internet connection is defined by object 'InternetGatewayDevice.X_AVM-DE_IPv6.' Read access will always return "n/a". Write access will be ignored. Allowed values: "ipv4only", "ipv6only", "dual"

parameter.name: X_AVM-DE_ARP_reply_for_any_local
parameter.description: Flag for internet connections via DHCP. If this parameter is true FRITZ!OS will reply ARP requests coming from a sender outside their assigned IPv4 subnet.

parameter.description: Assign IP protocol (IPv4, IPv6, Dualstack) to be used on this connection. Special behaviour on 'internet' connection: IP protocol on internet connection is defined by object 'InternetGatewayDevice.X_AVM-DE_IPv6.' Read access will always return "n/a". Write access will be ignored. Allowed values: "ipv4only", "ipv6only", "dual"

parameter.name: X_AVM-DE_Username_Prefix_List
parameter.description:
The Realm extensions are used to extend the username (front) during a pppoe connection process. Realms are used from left to right. A valid realm will be moved to the front - it will be used automatically in the next connection process.
Examples: ",W" -> Empty entry at the beginning "H,,X" -> Empty entry at the middle "A,B," -> Empty entry at the end "A" -> Just one single entry

parameter.name: X_AVM-DE_Username_Prefix_VDSL_List
parameter.description:
The Realm extensions are used to extend the username (front) during a pppoe connection process. Realms are used from left to right. A valid realm will be moved to the front - it will be used automatically in the next connection process.
Examples: ",W" -> Empty entry at the beginning "H,,X" -> Empty entry at the middle "A,B," -> Empty entry at the end "A" -> Just one single entry

parameter.description: Enables a MTU/MRU greater than 1492 in the PPPoE protocol. See RFC4638.

object.name: InternetGatewayDevice.WANDevice.{i}.WANConnectionDevice.{i}.X_AVM-DE_WANUMTSLinkConfig.Backup.
object.description: Fallback functionality. Currently only supported for DSL-Boxes. In case of DSL sync loss establish a internet connection via UMTS.

parameter.name: Enabled
parameter.description: Enable UMTS backup

parameter.name: AdvancedFailureBackup
parameter.description: Enables advanced failover that triggers on all types of errors on the primary connection (PPP error, ...) instead of only sync loss. Requires a working mobile backup device (USB Serial or MBIM). On FRITZ!Box 6890, this parameter is a no-op.

parameter.name: Quickstart
parameter.description: Only available for providers with UMTS-Quickstart functionality. Returned values: 0: quickstart_off 1: quickstart_active 2: quickstart_done

parameter.name: Downtime
parameter.description: Time after DSL sync loss switching over to UMTS.

parameter.name: Reverttime
parameter.description: Time switching from UMTS to DSL after regaining a stable DSL Sync.

object.name: InternetGatewayDevice.User.{i}.
object.description: see TR-157. User credentials for remote access One (1) object is preinstanciated. Only one (1) user object supported.

parameter.name: Username
parameter.description: Note Security Issue: Write Access to "Username" triggers internally the creation of a random generated username. The random generated username can be read by the ACS with GetParameterValue. This mechanism prevents that a ACS configures the remote access of all CPEs with the same user credentials.

parameter.name: Language
parameter.description: Language switch not supported

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enable/disable UPnP

parameter.name: UPnPMediaServer
parameter.description: Enable/disable MediaServer

object.name: InternetGatewayDevice.X_AVM-DE_IPv6.{i}.
object.description: IPv6 Settings

parameter.name: DNS1
parameter.description: IPv6 address of first DNS Server

parameter.name: DNS1_Origin
parameter.description: Delivers the origin of the DNS1 IPv6 address. Possible values: "static", "ra", "dhcp6", "".

parameter.name: DNS2
parameter.description: IPv6 address of second DNS Server

parameter.name: DNS2_Origin
parameter.description: Delivers the origin of the DNS2 IPv6 address. Possible values: "static", "ra", "dhcp6", "".

parameter.name: DP
parameter.description: Delegated Prefix.

parameter.name: DP_PreferedLifetime
parameter.description: Prefered lifetime of delegated prefix in seconds. Value = -1 indicatices INFINITE.

parameter.name: DP_ValidLifetime
parameter.description: Valid lifetime of delegated prefix in seconds. Value = -1 indicatices INFINITE.

parameter.name: IPAddress
parameter.description: Connection IPv6 address including prefix.

parameter.name: LANPrefixLen
parameter.description: The length of the LAN Prefix.

parameter.name: Manual_AFTR_FQDN
parameter.description: OEM specific parameter. Not available on all F!Box models.

parameter.name: Mode
parameter.description: IPv6 Mode to obtain the global IPv6 address of the router. Following modes are supprted (Strings are case sensitive!): "ipv6_off" "ipv6_ipv4native" (native IPv4 und native IPv6, Dual Stack) "ipv6_tunnel_6to4" "ipv6_tunnel_6rd" "ipv6_tunnel_6in4" "ipv6_tunnel_sixxs" "ipv6_native" (auto negociate global IPv6 address) "ipv6_native_dhcp6" (get global address only by DHCPv6) "ipv6_native_prefix" (get global address by prefix assignment) "ipv6_native_static" (use static configuration)

parameter.name: MTU
parameter.description: Write access with values >= 1280 will override the default MTU. Value=0 will switch to default MTU.

parameter.name: NTP1
parameter.description: IPv6 address of first NTP Server

parameter.name: NTP1_Origin
parameter.description: Delivers the origin of the NTP1 IPv6 address. Possible values: "static", "ra", "dhcp6", "".

parameter.name: NTP2
parameter.description: IPv6 address of second NTP Server

parameter.name: NTP2_Origin
parameter.description: Delivers the origin of the NTP2 IPv6 address. Possible values: "static", "ra", "dhcp6", "".

parameter.name: Origin
parameter.description: Delivers the origin of the global IPv6 address. Possible values: "ra", "ia_na", "ia_pd", "6to4", "6rd".

parameter.name: PreferedLifetime
parameter.description: eUint. Connection prefered lifetime in seconds. Value = -1 indicatices INFINITE. Missspelling of Preferred but kept because working

parameter.name: RequestLANPrefixLen
parameter.description: Request a specific LAN Prefix length by setting this paramter to true. The requested LAN Prefix length is specified by LANPrefixLen.

parameter.name: Status
parameter.description: Returns the current state: "disabled", "disconnected", "connecting", "connected"

parameter.name: Uptime
parameter.description: eUint. Connection uptime in sec.

parameter.name: ValidLifetime
parameter.description: eUint. Connection valid lifetime in seconds. Value = -1 indicatices INFINITE.

parameter.name: WANConnectionDevice
parameter.description: Indicates reference of this object to the wan connection. Currently only "..WANConnection.1" is supported.

object.name: InternetGatewayDevice.X_AVM-DE_IPv6.{i}.PortMapping.{i}.
object.description: Port mapping table for IPv6 Portmappings.

parameter.name: PortMappingEnabled
parameter.description: Portmapping state.

parameter.name: PortMappingLeaseDuration
parameter.description: F!OS IPv6 portmappings are static; parameter always returns "0"

parameter.name: RemoteHost
parameter.description: Always returns "".

parameter.name: InternalClient
parameter.description: Since F!OS does not use NAT for IPv6, the internal client is always a globally unique IPv6 address.

object.name: InternetGatewayDevice.X_AVM-DE_IPv6.{i}.DS_Lite.
object.description: Dual Stack Lite. To activate DS-Lite the IPv6 Mode must be set to one of the native modes: set "InternetGatewayDevice.X_AVM-DE_IPv6.{i}.Mode" to "ipv6_native" or "ipv6_native_dhcp6" or "ipv6_native_prefix" or "ipv6_native_static".

parameter.name: Mode
parameter.description: Enumeration of "dslite_off" "dslite_AFTRbyDHCP6": get AFTR by DHCPv6 "dslite_AFTRstatic": set AFTR manually

parameter.name: AFTR
parameter.description: Return currently used AFTR. To use a AFTR other than assigned by DHCPv6 6 set Mode="dslite_AFTRstatic" and a static AFTR IPv6 address

parameter.name: Use_GW_as_PCPServer
parameter.description: Use Gateway as PCP Server

object.name: InternetGatewayDevice.X_AVM-DE_IPv6.{i}.IPv6_6rd.
object.description: 6rd Tunnel. To activate 6rd tunnel the IPv6 Mode must be set to "ipv6_tunnel_6rd": "InternetGatewayDevice.X_AVM-DE_IPv6.{i}.Mode" = "ipv6_tunnel_6rd"

parameter.name: IPv4Endpoint

object.name: InternetGatewayDevice.X_AVM-DE_IPv6.{i}.IPv6_6in4.

parameter.name: IPv4Endpoint
parameter.description: IPv4 address of tunnel endpoint.

parameter.name: IPv6Endpoint

parameter.name: IPv6LocalAddr
parameter.description: IPv6 local address.. Changed to InternetGatewayDevice.X_AVM-DE_IPv6.1.IPv6_6in4.IPv6LocalAddr from InternetGatewayDevice.X_AVM-DE_IPv6.1.IPv6_6in4.IPv6LocalAddress

parameter.name: WAN_use_Prefix_of_LAN

parameter.description: Assign WAN-InterfaceID automatically.

parameter.name: DNS1
parameter.description: IPv6 address of first DNS Server

parameter.name: DNS2
parameter.description: IPv6 address of second DNS Server

object.name: InternetGatewayDevice.X_AVM-DE_IPv6.{i}.LAN.
object.description: LAN IPv6 Configuation (Homenet).

parameter.name: Allow_other_Prefixes
parameter.description: Allow advertised prefixes of other IPv6 routers in LAN.

parameter.name: RA_adv_DNS
parameter.description: Advertise DNSv6 Server via Router Advertisement in LAN. (RFC 5006).

parameter.name: ULAMode
parameter.description: Specifies the assignment of ULA to devices. Enumeration of "ulamode_off": do not assign ULA "ulamode_dynamic": assign ULA as long as no IPv6 connection has been established "ulamode_persist": always assign ULA

parameter.name: ULAPrefix
parameter.description: Currently used ULA-Prefix of F!Box.

parameter.name: ULAPrefixOverride
parameter.description: Use static ULA Prefix for F!Box : (Notation: fd01:1212:3434:5656::/64). Reset to automatic configuration by value = "" or "::"

object.name: InternetGatewayDevice.X_AVM-DE_IPv6.{i}.LAN.DHCP6Server.
object.description: Configuration of DHCPv6 Server in LAN.

parameter.name: Mode
parameter.description: Possible DHCPv6 modes [RA: O-Flag, M-Flag]: "off" [O-0, M-0, no answer on requests] "stateless" [O-1, M-0, only info requests] "stateful" [O-1, M-1, ia_na and ia_pd] "onlyprefixes" [O-1, M-0, only ia_pd] "off_stateless" [O-1, M-0, no answer] "off_stateful" [O-1, M-1, no answer]

object.name: InternetGatewayDevice.X_AVM-DE_AdvancedSettings.
object.description: AVM vendor specific object

parameter.name: Annex
parameter.description: DSL-Annex. Supported standards: "A" and "B". Reboot required.

parameter.name: ATAMode_GUI_hidden
parameter.description: Hide connectiontypes in WebGUI.

parameter.name: AvailableCountries
parameter.description: Comma sep. String of supported countries as specified by ISO 3166. Only available on boxes with MULTI_COUNTRY supprot. (99=other country).

parameter.name: BNG_Arch
parameter.description: indicates if BNG Architecture exists

parameter.name: Upstream_optimize
parameter.description: Upstream optimization. Functionality is hardware dependent.

parameter.name: Upstream_optimize_count
parameter.description: Number of bundled Ack frames. Functionality is hardware dependent.

parameter.name: Upstream_optimize_period
parameter.description: Time clock for bundled Ack frames. Functionality is hardware dependent.

parameter.name: Country
parameter.description: The value MUST be one value selected from "AvailableCountries". Only available on boxes with MULTI_COUNTRY support. (99=other country). Reboot required.

parameter.name: Disable_Buttons
parameter.description: Deactivate all hardware pushbuttons events.

parameter.name: DSLPerformance
parameter.description:
Please use the following parameter instead: InternetGatewayDevice.WANDevice.{i}.WANDSLInterfaceConfig.DSLPerformance.OffsetDsMargin InternetGatewayDevice.WANDevice.{i}.WANDSLInterfaceConfig.DSLPerformance.DsINP InternetGatewayDevice.WANDevice.{i}.WANDSLInterfaceConfig.DSLPerformance.RFI_mode InternetGatewayDevice.WANDevice.{i}.WANDSLInterfaceConfig.DSLPerformance.UsNoiseBits
Indicates the DSL performace/stability. Allowed configuration values: 0 ... 40 0 -> max. performance 40 -> max. stability (only available on xDSL-FRITZ!Box)

parameter.name: DynDNSEnabled
parameter.description: Indicates if Dynamic DNS has been enabled

parameter.name: FeatureSwitch
parameter.description: Support for features WLAN and DECT. Following bitmask describes settings: Write access "0" : all features on. Write access "0x001" : Feature WLAN off. Write access "0x008" : Feature DECT off. Read access will deliver a empty string. Parameter is OEM and hardware specific.

parameter.name: GUIExpertmode
parameter.description: Indicates if WebGUI expertmode has been configured

parameter.name: InfoLED
parameter.description: Delivers a user readable string how the info LED has been mapped

parameter.name: IPv4NeededOnWan
parameter.description: Returns a hexadecimal Bitmask which describes all services requireing IPv4. Each bit representing its service: HTTPS_REMOTE_ACCESS 0x0001 FTP_NAS_FORWARD 0x0002 EXPOSED_HOST 0x0004 FORWARD_FOR_LAN_ACCESS 0x0008 OWN_FORWORD_FROM_LANCLIENT_POSSIBLE 0x0010 SMART_HOME 0x0020 VPN 0x0040

parameter.name: IPv6_GUI_hidden
parameter.description: Hide IPv6 WebGUI page

parameter.name: LANBridges_GUI_hidden
parameter.description: Hide LAN-Bridges WebGUI page

parameter.name: LineId
parameter.description: ACS can set an identifier of used line. Id-String will be displayed in GUI (depends on hardware)

parameter.name: NightServiceForRingBlock
parameter.description: Indicates if ring block nightservice has been configured

parameter.name: NightServiceForWLAN
parameter.description: Indicates if WLAN nightservice has been configured

parameter.name: Prioritisation
parameter.description:
User readable comma-seperated string that indicates the prioritisation of applications.
The priorities could contain the following values: "prio_none", "prio_veryhigh", "prio_high", "prio_medium", "prio_low"
The user is able to define the following priorties on the web-interface: Real-time applications: prio_veryhigh Prior applications: prio_high Background applications: prio_low
Example: Internettelefonie=prio_veryhigh, FRITZ!Media Videostreaming=prio_veryhigh, HTTP-Server=prio_veryhigh, eMule=prio_high, Telnet=prio_low

parameter.name: ProviderDefaultConfigVersion
parameter.description: Version of specific Providerprofile.

parameter.name: PVC2_GUI_hidden
parameter.description: Hide ATM config of 2. PVC (voip) in WebGUI. (only relevant for xDSL capable boxes)

parameter.name: Country_GUI_hidden
parameter.description: Hide Country settings in WebGUI.

parameter.name: Support1TR114Patch
parameter.description: Reset SIP VLAN Prio to 0 in 'Deutsche Telekom' resale architecture (default is VLAN Prio = 6). This parameter is available only in VDSL capable boxes.

parameter.name: WANMAC
parameter.description: Read: MAC used for WAN internet connection Write: use this MAC.( notation aa:bb:cc:dd:ee:ff)

parameter.name: WANMACOverride
parameter.description: Indicates if the WANMAC is the CPE's default MAC. Set to false to use the CPE's default MAC. Value true can't be written. Setting this value may lead to temporary loss of internet connection.

parameter.name: Enabled
parameter.description: Enable the flag to activate DNSoverTLS. Disable it to deactivate the feature

parameter.name: Strict
parameter.description:
There are two different operation modes for the DNSoverTLS feature (strict and opportunistic). If the flag is enabled, the strict mode is activated otherwise the opportunistic mode is activated.
strict mode: If the flag is enabled, only DNSoverTLS server with a valid certificate chain and a valid FQDN-CN or FQDN-SAN matching are allowed. If one of both validation steps fail then the DNSoverTLS server is deactivated.
opportunistic mode: If the flag is disabled, DNSoverTLS servers are used even if the certificate chain validation step fails. In this case an opportunistic TLS connection to the server is established without knowing if the server is who it says it is.
Attention: This mode should only be activated if the identity of the server is well known and a man in the middle attack can be precluded.

parameter.name: UDP_Fallback
parameter.description:
If none of the specified DNSoverTLS servers works as expected, a fallback to UDP can be performed. This means that only the configured UDP-based DNS servers are used.
If the flag is enabled then the fallback is allowed. Otherwise it is not.
Attention: If the flag is disabled and all DNSoverTLS servers fail, no DNS requests can be sent anymore.

parameter.name: FQDNs
parameter.description:
Valid FQDNs. The list is used to resolve the IP adresses of the DNSoverTLS servers. Depending on whether IPv6 has been enabled,IPv4 only or IPv4 and IPv6 addresses are resolved. The resolve is executed by the DNS servers provided via DSL/Cable.
For example: "dns.google,dns.quad9.net" for the DoT servers of Google and Quad9.
After the certificate chain has been validated during the common TLS validation process, the FQDNs are checked against the Common Name (CN) and Subject Alternative Names (SANs).

object.name: InternetGatewayDevice.X_AVM-DE_Budget.
object.description: ACS controlled bandwidth regulation

parameter.name: UserBudget
parameter.description: Allowed User Budget in MB, only informative

parameter.name: VolumeCount
parameter.description: Current Volume Count in MB since last reset

parameter.name: ResetVolumeCount
parameter.description: Reset VolumeCount, allowed value=1

parameter.name: BandwithRegulation
parameter.description: 1=active, 0=not active. NOTE: activating BandwithRegulation is not retained across reboots.

object.name: InternetGatewayDevice.X_AVM-DE_SpeedtestServer.
object.description: Starts an iperf server on the CPE for TCP and UDP speedtests. For detailed information about Speedtest Measuring see separate document.

object.name: InternetGatewayDevice.X_AVM-DE_SpeedtestServer.TCP.
object.description: TCP iperf server

parameter.name: Start
parameter.description: Write access to this Parameter will start TCP Server

parameter.name: Stop
parameter.description: Write access to this Parameter will stop TCP Server

parameter.name: Reset
parameter.description: Write access to this Parameter will reset statistic.

parameter.name: Port
parameter.description: TCP Listen port for speedtest server

parameter.name: Result
parameter.description: User readable string with the byte and packet statistic of the current or last speedtest. Example "Bytes 4803924 \t BPS 104501 \t AVG 116106 Packets 3294 PPS 26 AVG 9"

parameter.name: State
parameter.description: User readable string returning the state of the speedtest server. For ex.: "TCP 4711 connected UDP off".

parameter.name: WANAccess
parameter.description: Open TCP port for WAN Access

object.name: InternetGatewayDevice.X_AVM-DE_SpeedtestServer.UDP.
object.description: UDP iperf server

parameter.name: DurationDownstreamTest
parameter.description: Duration of downstream test. For upstream only tests set this parameter to 0.

parameter.name: DurationUpstreamTest
parameter.description:
Duration of upstream test. For downstream only tests set this paramter to 0.
Note: The upstream test method is not working on all device types properly.

parameter.name: Port
parameter.description: UDP Listen port for speedtest server

parameter.name: PortBidirect
parameter.description: UDP Listen port for bidirectional speedtest server. Received data on this port will be sent back to sender.

parameter.name: Reset
parameter.description: Write access to this parameter will reset statistic.

parameter.name: Result
parameter.description:
User readable string with the byte and packet statistic of the current or last speedtest.
After command "Start": "Bytes 4803924 \t BPS 104501 \t AVG 116106 Packets 3294 PPS 26 AVG 9" After command "StartSpeedtest": "Downstream (kbit/s)\tAVG 45333\tMIN 2367\tMAX 64578"

parameter.name: Start
parameter.description: Write access to this parameter will start UDP server

parameter.name: StartBidirect
parameter.description: Write access to this parameter will start fullduplex UDP server. Box will transmit received data back to sender.

parameter.name: StartSpeedtest
parameter.description: Start Speedtest.

parameter.name: State
parameter.description: User readable string returning the state of the speedtest server. For ex.: "TCP 4711 connected UDP off"

parameter.name: Stop
parameter.description: Write access to this parameter will stop UDP server

parameter.name: StopBidirect
parameter.description: Write access to this parameter will stop UDP bidirect server.

parameter.name: StopSpeedtest
parameter.description: Stop Speedtest.

parameter.name: WANAccess
parameter.description: Open UDP port for WAN Access

object.name: InternetGatewayDevice.X_AVM-DE_DiagnosticTools.TraceRouteDiagnostics.
object.description: invoke a traceroute test on the CPE

parameter.name: DiagnosticsState
parameter.description: Indicates availability of traceroute diagnostic data. One of: "None" "Requested" "Timeout" "Complete" Value may be set to Requested to initiate the diagnostic test. When writing, the only allowed value is Requested. To ensure the use of the proper test parameters (the writable parameters in this object), the test parameters MUST be set either prior to or at the same time as (in the same SetParameterValues) setting the DiagnosticState to Requested. When requested, CPE will wait until after completion of the communication session with the ACS before starting the diagnostic. When the diagnostic initiated by the ACS is completed (successfully or not), the CPE will establish a new connection to the ACS to allow the ACS to view the "Result", indicating the Event code "8 DIAGNOSTICS COMPLETE" in the Inform message.

parameter.name: ProtocolVersion
parameter.description: Describes rather IPv4 or IPv6 is used

parameter.name: Host
parameter.description: Hostname or IPv4 address

parameter.name: NumberOfTries
parameter.description: Number of probes per TTL (default 3)

parameter.name: Timeout
parameter.description: Timeout in seconds for the traceroute test (default 20).

parameter.name: MaxHopCount
parameter.description: Max number of hops (default 64)

parameter.name: Result
parameter.description: The result of the traceroute test. S.th. like "traceroute to avm.de (212.42.244.80), 30 hops max, 38 byte packets 1 ewnw-pppoe.blabla.de (88.234.237.139) 15.355 ms 15.704 ms 15.321 ms 2 ewnw-gate.blabla.de (88.234.237.144) 15.837 ms 15.767 ms 15.580 ms 3 88.234.237.2 (88.234.237.2) 16.502 ms 16.427 ms 16.750 ms ..."

object.name: InternetGatewayDevice.X_AVM-DE_DiagnosticTools.NSLookupDiagnostics.
object.description: invoke a nslookup test on the CPE

parameter.name: DiagnosticsState
parameter.description: Indicates availability of nslookup diagnostic data. One of: "None" "Requested" "Timeout" "Complete" Value may be set to Requested to initiate the diagnostic test. When writing, the only allowed value is Requested. To ensure the use of the proper test parameters (the writable parameters in this object), the test parameters MUST be set either prior to or at the same time as (in the same SetParameterValues) setting the DiagnosticState to Requested. When requested, CPE will wait until after completion of the communication session with the ACS before starting the diagnostic. When the diagnostic initiated by the ACS is completed (successfully or not), the CPE will establish a new connection to the ACS to allow the ACS to view the "Result", indicating the Event code "8 DIAGNOSTICS COMPLETE" in the Inform message.

parameter.name: Interface
parameter.description: Specifies the interface to use for the DNS lookup. For ex. "InternetGatewayDevice.WANConnection.1.WANConnectionDevice.1.WANPPPConnection.1.". If an empty string is specified the default internet connection is used.

parameter.name: Host
parameter.description: Hostname

parameter.name: DNSServer
parameter.description: IPv4 or IPv6 address of the DNS server to use. If an empty string is specified, the device's default DNS server will be used.

parameter.name: Timeout
parameter.description: Timeout in seconds for the nslookup test (default 10).

parameter.name: Result
parameter.description:
The result of the nslookup test. S.th. like:
Server: 2a01:198:24f:3004::2 Name: www.ix.de Address 1: 193.99.144.80 Address 2: 2a02:2e0:3fe:100::8
responsetime: 19 ms

object.name: InternetGatewayDevice.X_AVM-DE_DiagnosticTools.IPTV.

parameter.name: LastMCfromWAN

parameter.name: MCServer

parameter.name: Status

parameter.name: ServerNameOrAddress
parameter.description: The FQDN or IP address of the PCP Server, assigned as described under {{param|Origin}}.

parameter.name: ExternalIPAddress
parameter.description: The external IP address of the PCP-controlled device hosting this server.

parameter.name: ServerNameOrIPv6Address
parameter.description: The FQDN or IPv6 address of the PCP Server, assigned as described under {{param|Origin}}.

parameter.name: ExternalIPv6Address
parameter.description: The external IPv6 address of the PCP-controlled device hosting this server.

parameter.name: PortRanges
parameter.description: Used to set the port ranges available for the user. Multiple port ranges could be specified using comma-seperation, eg.: "31200-31300,34500-34550"

object.name: InternetGatewayDevice.X_AVM-DE_TWAMPReflector.
object.description: This object contains parameters associated with the configuration that permits this interface to be used as Two-Way Active Measurement Protocol (TWAMP) reflector

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables or disables the TWAMP reflector.

parameter.name: Port
parameter.description: The port used to listen for the TWAMP test packets.

parameter.name: MaximumTTL
parameter.description: The maximum TTL of a received packet that this TWAMP reflector will reflect to the TWAMP controller.

profile.name: StandbyPolicy:1
profile.description: Note that support for this profile implies support for the requirements of {{bibref|TR-069a5|Annex L}}.
